body:
Comment 1: 
According to the spec (Comparison operators):

"The operands must be comparable; that is, the first operand must be assignable to the
type of the second operand, or vice versa."

Obviously, doCompare is assignable to foo. This is a 6g bug. gccgo accepts and runs the
code.
_Labels changed: added **compilerbug**._ _Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
